00049 
00050 void testCode()
00051 {
00052         // Use of utility and conversion functions.
00053         unsigned long ipAddress = inet_addr("128.64.16.2");
00054 
00055         struct in_addr addr;
00056         addr.S_un.S_addr = htonl(0x88482818);
00057 
00058         char ipAddressString[16];
00059         strcpy(ipAddressString, inet_ntoa(addr));
00060 
00061         char buffer[256];
00062         sprintf(buffer, "0x%08x 0x%08x %s\n:", ipAddress, addr.S_un.S_addr, ipAddressString);
00063         OutputDebugStringA(buffer);
00064 
00065 
00066         // Use of DNS functions
00067         struct hostent *pHostEnt; 
00068         const char *host = "ftp.microsoft.com";
00069         pHostEnt = gethostbyname(host);
00070 
00071     if (pHostEnt == NULL)
00072     {
00073         fprintf(stderr, "No such host");
00074     }
00075         else
00076         {
00077             struct sockaddr_in addr;
00078                 memcpy(&addr.sin_addr,pHostEnt->h_addr,pHostEnt->h_length);
00079 
00080                 char buffer[256];
00081                 sprintf(buffer, "Address of %s is 0x%08x\n", host, ntohl(addr.sin_addr.s_addr));
00082                 OutputDebugStringA(buffer);
00083         }
00084 
00085         unsigned int netip = inet_addr("207.46.133.140");
00086         pHostEnt = gethostbyaddr((const char *)&netip, 4, PF_INET);
00087 }

00092 //
00093 // TextPacket::TextPacket                       - Chapter 16, page 607
00094 //
00095 TextPacket::TextPacket(char const * const text)
00096  :BinaryPacket(static_cast<u_long>(strlen(text) + 2))
00097 { 
00098         MemCpy(text, strlen(text), 0);
00099         MemCpy("\r\n", 2, 2);
00100         *(u_long *)m_Data = 0;
00101 }

00123 //
00124 // NetSocket::NetSocket                         - Chapter 16, page 609
00125 //
00126 NetSocket::NetSocket(SOCKET new_sock, unsigned int hostIP)
00127 {
00128         m_sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00129         m_deleteFlag = 0;
00130         m_sendOfs = 0;
00131         m_timeOut = 0;
00132 
00133         m_bBinaryProtocol = 1;
00134 
00135         m_recvOfs = m_recvBegin = 0;
00136         m_internal = 0;
00137 
00138         m_timeCreated = timeGetTime();
00139 
00140         m_sock = new_sock;
00141         m_ipaddr = hostIP;
00142 
00143         m_internal = g_pSocketManager->IsInternal(m_ipaddr);
00144 
00145         setsockopt (m_sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_DONTLINGER, NULL, 0);
00146 
00147         if (m_ipaddr)
00148         {
00149                 TCHAR buffer[128];
00150                 const char *ansiIpaddress = g_pSocketManager->GetHostByAddr(m_ipaddr);
00151                 if (ansiIpaddress)
00152                 {
00153                         TCHAR genIpaddress[64];
00154                         AnsiToGenericCch(genIpaddress, ansiIpaddress, static_cast<int>(strlen(ansiIpaddress)+1));
00155                         _tcssprintf(buffer, _T("User connected: %s %s"), genIpaddress, (m_internal) ? _T("(internal)") : _T(""));
00156                         OutputDebugString(buffer);
00157                 }
00158         }
00159 }

00164 //
00165 NetSocket::~NetSocket() 
00166 {
00167         if (m_sock != INVALID_SOCKET) 
00168         {
00169                 closesocket(m_sock);
00170                 m_sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00171         }
00172  }

00176 //
00177 // NetSocket::Connect                           - Chapter 16, page 611
00178 //
00179 bool NetSocket::Connect(unsigned int ip, unsigned int port, int fCoalesce) 
00180 {
00181         struct sockaddr_in sa;
00182         int x = 1;
00183 
00184         if ((m_sock = socket(PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) == INVALID_SOCKET)
00185                 return false;
00186 
00187         if (!fCoalesce)
00188         {
00189                 setsockopt(m_sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, (char *)&x, sizeof(x));
00190         }
00191 
00192         //      setsockopt(m_sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_KEEPALIVE, (char *)&x, sizeof(x));
00193 
00194         sa.sin_family = AF_INET;
00195         sa.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(ip);
00196         sa.sin_port = htons(port);
00197 
00198         if (connect(m_sock, (struct sockaddr *)&sa, sizeof(sa))) 
00199         {
00200                 closesocket(m_sock);
00201                 m_sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00202                 return false;
00203         }
00204 
00205         return true;
00206  }

00211 void NetSocket::Send(shared_ptr<IPacket> pkt, bool clearTimeOut)
00212 {
00213         if (clearTimeOut)
00214                 m_timeOut = 0;
00215 
00216         m_OutList.push_back(pkt);
00217 }

00219 //
00220 // NetSocket::SetBlocking                               - Chapter 16, page 612
00221 //
00222 void NetSocket::SetBlocking(int block) 
00223 {
00224         #ifdef WIN32
00225                 unsigned long val = block ? 0 : 1;
00226                 ioctlsocket(m_sock, FIONBIO, &val);
00227         #else
00228                 int val = fcntl(m_sock, F_GETFL, 0);
00229                 if (block)
00230                         val &= ~(O_NONBLOCK);
00231                 else
00232                         val |= O_NONBLOCK;
00233 
00234                 fcntl(m_sock, F_SETFL, val);
00235         #endif
00236 }

00238 
00239 //
00240 // NetSocket::HandleOutput                              - Chapter 16, page 612
00241 //
00242 void NetSocket::HandleOutput() 
00243 {
00244         int fSent = 0;
00245         do 
00246         {
00247                 assert(!m_OutList.empty());
00248                 PacketList::iterator i = m_OutList.begin();
00249 
00250                 shared_ptr<IPacket> pkt = *i;
00251                 const char *buf = pkt->VGetData();
00252                 int len = static_cast<int>(pkt->VGetSize());
00253 
00254                 int rc = send(m_sock, buf+m_sendOfs, len-m_sendOfs, 0);
00255                 if (rc > 0) 
00256                 {
00257                         g_pSocketManager->m_Outbound += rc;
00258                         m_sendOfs += rc;
00259                         fSent = 1;
00260                 }
00261                 else if (WSAGetLastError() != WSAEWOULDBLOCK)
00262                 {
00263                         HandleException();
00264                         fSent = 0;
00265                 }
00266                 else
00267                 {
00268                         fSent = 0;
00269                 }
00270 
00271                 if (m_sendOfs == pkt->VGetSize()) 
00272                 {
00273                         m_OutList.pop_front();
00274                         m_sendOfs = 0;
00275                 }
00276 
00277         } while ( fSent && !m_OutList.empty() );
00278 }
00279 
00280 
00281 
00282 //
00283 // NetSocket::HandleInput                               - Chapter 16, page 613
00284 //
00285 void NetSocket::HandleInput() 
00286 {
00287         bool bPktRecieved = false;
00288         u_long packetSize = 0;
00289         int rc = recv(m_sock, m_recvBuf+m_recvBegin+m_recvOfs, RECV_BUFFER_SIZE-m_recvOfs, 0);
00290 
00291         char metrics[1024];
00292         sprintf(metrics, "Incoming: %6d bytes. Begin %6d Offset %4d\n", rc, m_recvBegin, m_recvOfs);
00293         OutputDebugStringA(metrics);
00294 
00295         if (rc==0)
00296         {
00297                 return;
00298         }
00299 
00300         if (rc < 0)
00301         {
00302                 m_deleteFlag = 1;
00303                 return;
00304         }
00305 
00306         const int hdrSize = sizeof(u_long);
00307         unsigned int newData = m_recvOfs + rc;
00308         int processedData = 0;
00309 
00310         while (newData > hdrSize)
00311         {
00312                 // There are two types of packets at the lowest level of our design:
00313                 // BinaryPacket - Sends the size as a positive 4 byte integer
00314                 // TextPacket - Sends 0 for the size, the parser will search for a CR
00315 
00316                 packetSize = *(reinterpret_cast<u_long*>(m_recvBuf+m_recvBegin));
00317                 packetSize = ntohl(packetSize);
00318 
00319                 if (m_bBinaryProtocol)
00320                 {
00321                         // we don't have enough new data to grab the next packet
00322                         if (newData < packetSize)
00323                                 break;
00324 
00325                         if (packetSize > MAX_PACKET_SIZE)
00326                         {
00327                                 // prevent nasty buffer overruns!
00328                                 HandleException();
00329                                 return;
00330                         }
00331 
00332                         if (newData >= packetSize)
00333                         {
00334                                 // we know how big the packet is...and we have the whole thing
00335                                 char test[1024];
00336                                 memcpy(test, &m_recvBuf[m_recvBegin+hdrSize], packetSize);
00337                                 test[packetSize+1]='\r';
00338                                 test[packetSize+2]='\n';
00339                                 test[packetSize+3]=0;
00340                                 OutputDebugStringA(test);
00341                                 shared_ptr<BinaryPacket> pkt(GCC_NEW BinaryPacket(&m_recvBuf[m_recvBegin+hdrSize], packetSize-hdrSize));
00342                                 m_InList.push_back(pkt);
00343                                 bPktRecieved = true;
00344                                 processedData += packetSize;
00345                                 newData -= packetSize;
00346                                 m_recvBegin += packetSize;
00347                         }
00348                 }
00349                 else
00350                 {
00351                         // the text protocol waits for a carraige return and creates a string
00352                         char *cr = static_cast<char *>(memchr(&m_recvBuf[m_recvBegin], 0x0a, rc));
00353                         if (cr)
00354                         {
00355                                 *(cr+1) = 0;
00356                                 shared_ptr<TextPacket> pkt(GCC_NEW TextPacket(&m_recvBuf[m_recvBegin]));
00357                                 m_InList.push_back(pkt);
00358                                 packetSize = cr - &m_recvBuf[m_recvBegin];
00359                                 bPktRecieved = true;
00360 
00361                                 processedData += packetSize;
00362                                 newData -= packetSize;
00363                                 m_recvBegin += packetSize;
00364                         }
00365                 }
00366         }
00367 
00368         g_pSocketManager->m_Inbound += rc;
00369         m_recvOfs = newData;
00370 
00371         if (bPktRecieved)
00372         {
00373                 if (m_recvOfs == 0)
00374                 {
00375                         m_recvOfs = 0;
00376                         m_recvBegin = 0;
00377                 }
00378                 else if (m_recvBegin + m_recvOfs + MAX_PACKET_SIZE > RECV_BUFFER_SIZE)
00379                 {
00380                         // we don't want to overrun the buffer - so we copy the leftover bits 
00381                         // to the beginning of the recieve buffer and start over
00382                         int leftover = m_recvOfs;
00383                         memcpy(m_recvBuf, &m_recvBuf[m_recvBegin], m_recvOfs);
00384                         m_recvBegin = 0;
00385                 }
00386         }       
00387 }

00395 NetListenSocket::NetListenSocket(int portnum) 
00396 {
00397         port = 0;
00398         Init(portnum);
00399 }

00401 
00402 //
00403 // NetListenSocket::Init                                - Chapter 16, page 616
00404 //
00405 void NetListenSocket::Init(int portnum)
00406 {
00407         struct sockaddr_in sa;
00408         int x = 1;
00409 
00410         if ((m_sock = socket(PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) == INVALID_SOCKET)
00411         {
00412                 perror("NetListenSocket::Init: socket");
00413                 EXIT_ASSERT
00414                 exit(1);
00415         }
00416 
00417         if (setsockopt(m_sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, (char *)&x, sizeof(x))== SOCKET_ERROR) 
00418         {
00419                 perror("NetListenSocket::Init: setsockopt");
00420                 closesocket(m_sock);
00421                 m_sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00422                 EXIT_ASSERT
00423                 exit(1);
00424         }
00425         
00426         memset(&sa, 0, sizeof(sa));
00427         sa.sin_family = AF_INET;
00428         sa.sin_addr.s_addr = ADDR_ANY;
00429         sa.sin_port = htons(portnum);
00430 
00431         // bind to port
00432         if (bind(m_sock, (struct sockaddr *)&sa, sizeof(sa)) == SOCKET_ERROR) 
00433         {
00434                 perror("NetListenSocket::Init: bind");
00435                 closesocket(m_sock);
00436                 m_sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00437                 EXIT_ASSERT
00438                 exit(1);
00439         }
00440 
00441         // set nonblocking - accept() blocks under some odd circumstances otherwise
00442         SetBlocking(0);
00443 
00444         // start listening
00445         if (listen(m_sock, 256) == SOCKET_ERROR) 
00446         {
00447                 closesocket(m_sock);
00448                 m_sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00449                 EXIT_ASSERT
00450                 exit(1);
00451         }
00452 
00453         port = portnum;
00454 }
00455 
00456 //
00457 // NetListenSocket::InitScan                    - added post press
00458 //   Opens multiple ports to listen for connections.
00459 //
00460 void NetListenSocket::InitScan(int portnum_min, int portnum_max) 
00461 {
00462         struct sockaddr_in sa;
00463         int portnum, x = 1;
00464 
00465         if ((m_sock = socket(PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, IPPROTO_TCP)) == INVALID_SOCKET)
00466         {
00467                 EXIT_ASSERT
00468                 exit(1);
00469         }
00470 
00471         if (setsockopt(m_sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, (char *)&x, sizeof(x)) == SOCKET_ERROR) 
00472         {
00473                 closesocket(m_sock);
00474                 m_sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00475                 EXIT_ASSERT
00476                 exit(1);
00477         }
00478 
00479         memset(&sa, 0, sizeof(sa));
00480         sa.sin_family = AF_INET;
00481         for (portnum = portnum_min; portnum < portnum_max; portnum++) 
00482         {
00483                 sa.sin_port = htons(portnum);
00484                 // bind to port
00485                 if (bind(m_sock, (struct sockaddr *)&sa, sizeof(sa)) != SOCKET_ERROR)
00486                         break;
00487         }
00488 
00489         if (portnum == portnum_max) 
00490         {
00491                 closesocket(m_sock);
00492                 m_sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00493                 EXIT_ASSERT
00494                 exit(1);
00495         }
00496 
00497         // set nonblocking - accept() blocks under some odd circumstances otherwise
00498         SetBlocking(0);
00499 
00500         // start listening
00501         if (listen(m_sock, 8) == SOCKET_ERROR) 
00502         {
00503                 closesocket(m_sock);
00504                 m_sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00505                 EXIT_ASSERT
00506                 exit(1);
00507         }
00508 
00509         port = portnum;
00510  }
00511 
00512 //
00513 // NetListenSocket::AcceptConnection                            - Chapter 16, page 617
00514 //
00515 SOCKET NetListenSocket::AcceptConnection(unsigned int *pAddr)
00516 {
00517         SOCKET new_sock;
00518         struct sockaddr_in sock;
00519         int size;
00520 
00521         size = sizeof(sock);
00522 
00523         if ((new_sock = accept(m_sock, (struct sockaddr *)&sock, &size))== INVALID_SOCKET)
00524                 return INVALID_SOCKET;
00525 
00526         if (getpeername(new_sock, (struct sockaddr *)&sock, &size) == SOCKET_ERROR)
00527         {
00528                 closesocket(new_sock);
00529                 return INVALID_SOCKET;
00530         }
00531         *pAddr = ntohl(sock.sin_addr.s_addr);
00532         return new_sock;
00533  }

00555 //
00556 // BaseSocketManager::Init                                              - Chapter 16, page 620
00557 //
00558 bool BaseSocketManager::Init()
00559 {
00560         int errorCode = WSAStartup(0x0202, &m_WsaData);
00561         if (errorCode==0)
00562                 return true;
00563         else
00564         {
00565                 assert(0 && "WSAStartup failure!");
00566                 return false;
00567         }
00568 }

00571 //
00572 // BaseSocketManager::Shutdown                                  - Chapter 16, page 621
00573 //
00574 void BaseSocketManager::Shutdown()
00575 {
00576         // Get rid of all those pesky kids...
00577         while (!m_SockList.empty())
00578         {
00579                 delete *m_SockList.begin();
00580                 m_SockList.pop_front();
00581         }
00582 
00583         WSACleanup();
00584 }
00585 
00586 //
00587 // BaseSocketManager::AddSocket                                 - Chapter 16, page 621
00588 //
00589 int BaseSocketManager::AddSocket(NetSocket *socket) 
00590 { 
00591         socket->m_id = m_NextSocketId;
00592         m_SockList.push_front(socket); 
00593         
00594         int openSockets = static_cast<int>(m_SockList.size());
00595         
00596         if (openSockets > m_MaxOpenSockets)
00597                 ++m_MaxOpenSockets;
00598 
00599         m_SockMap[m_NextSocketId] = socket;
00600         ++m_NextSocketId; 
00601 
00602         return socket->m_id; 
00603 }
00604 
00605 //
00606 // BaseSocketManager::RemoveSocket                                      - Chapter 16, page 621
00607 //
00608 void BaseSocketManager::RemoveSocket(NetSocket *socket) 
00609 { 
00610         m_SockList.remove(socket); 
00611         m_SockMap.erase(socket->m_id);
00612         SAFE_DELETE(socket);
00613 }
00614 
00615 //
00616 // BaseSocketManager::FindSocket                                        - Chapter 16, page 622
00617 //
00618 NetSocket *BaseSocketManager::FindSocket(int sockId)
00619 {
00620         SocketIdMap::iterator i = m_SockMap.find(sockId);
00621         if (i==m_SockMap.end())
00622         {
00623                 return NULL;
00624         }
00625 
00626         return (*i).second;
00627 }
00628 
00629 //
00630 // BaseSocketManager::Send                                                      - Chapter 16, page 622
00631 //
00632 bool BaseSocketManager::Send(int sockId, shared_ptr<IPacket> packet)
00633 {
00634         NetSocket *sock = FindSocket(sockId);
00635         if (!sock)
00636                 return false;
00637         sock->Send(packet);
00638         return true;
00639 }
00640 
00641 //
00642 // BaseSocketManager::DoSelect                                  - Chapter 16, page 622
00643 //
00644 void BaseSocketManager::DoSelect(int pauseMicroSecs, int handleInput) 
00645 {
00646         timeval tv;
00647         tv.tv_sec = 0;
00648         tv.tv_usec = pauseMicroSecs;    // 100 microseconds is 0.1 milliseconds or .0001 seconds
00649 
00650         fd_set inp_set, out_set, exc_set;
00651         int maxdesc;
00652         NetSocket *pSock;
00653 
00654         FD_ZERO(&inp_set);
00655         FD_ZERO(&out_set);
00656         FD_ZERO(&exc_set);
00657 
00658         maxdesc = 0;
00659 
00660   // set everything up for the select
00661         for (SocketList::iterator i = m_SockList.begin(); i != m_SockList.end(); ++i)
00662         {
00663                 pSock = *i;
00664                 if ((pSock->m_deleteFlag&1) || pSock->m_sock == INVALID_SOCKET)
00665                         continue;
00666 
00667                 if (handleInput)
00668                         FD_SET(pSock->m_sock, &inp_set);
00669 
00670                 FD_SET(pSock->m_sock, &exc_set);
00671 
00672                 if (pSock->HasOutput())
00673                         FD_SET(pSock->m_sock, &out_set);
00674 
00675                 if ((int)pSock->m_sock > maxdesc)
00676                         maxdesc = (int)pSock->m_sock;
00677 
00678          }
00679   
00680         int selRet = 0;
00681 
00682         // do the select (duration passed in as tv, NULL to block until event)
00683         selRet = select(maxdesc+1, &inp_set, &out_set, &exc_set, &tv) ;
00684         if (selRet == SOCKET_ERROR)
00685         {
00686                 PrintError();
00687                 return;
00688         }
00689 
00690         // handle input, output, and exceptions
00691 
00692         if (selRet)
00693         {
00694                 for (SocketList::iterator i = m_SockList.begin(); i != m_SockList.end(); ++i)
00695                 {
00696                         pSock = *i;
00697 
00698                         if ((pSock->m_deleteFlag&1) || pSock->m_sock == INVALID_SOCKET)
00699                                 continue;
00700 
00701                         if (FD_ISSET(pSock->m_sock, &exc_set))
00702                         {
00703                                 pSock->HandleException();
00704                         }
00705 
00706                         if (!(pSock->m_deleteFlag&1) && FD_ISSET(pSock->m_sock, &out_set))
00707                         {
00708                                 pSock->HandleOutput();
00709                         }
00710 
00711                         if (   handleInput
00712                                 && !(pSock->m_deleteFlag&1) && FD_ISSET(pSock->m_sock, &inp_set))
00713                         {
00714                                 pSock->HandleInput();
00715                         }
00716                  }      
00717         }
00718 
00719         unsigned int timeNow = timeGetTime();
00720 
00721         // handle deleting any sockets
00722         for (SocketList::iterator i = m_SockList.begin(); i != m_SockList.end(); ++i)
00723         {
00724                 pSock = *i;
00725                 if (pSock->m_timeOut) 
00726                 {
00727                         if (pSock->m_timeOut < timeNow)
00728                         {
00729                                 pSock->TimeOut();
00730                         }
00731                 }
00732 
00733                 if (pSock->m_deleteFlag&1) 
00734                 {
00735                         switch (pSock->m_deleteFlag) 
00736                         {
00737                           case 1:
00738                                         --i;
00739                                         g_pSocketManager->RemoveSocket(pSock);
00740                                         break;
00741                                 case 3:
00742                                         pSock->m_deleteFlag = 2;
00743                                         if (pSock->m_sock != INVALID_SOCKET) 
00744                                         {
00745                                                 closesocket(pSock->m_sock);
00746                                                 pSock->m_sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
00747                                         }
00748                                         break;
00749                         }
00750                 }
00751 
00752          }
00753  }
00754 
00755 
00756 //
00757 // BaseSocketManager::IsInternal                                        - Chapter 16, page 626
00758 //
00759 bool BaseSocketManager::IsInternal(unsigned int ipaddr)
00760 {
00761         bool internal = false;
00762         if (m_SubnetMask)
00763         {
00764             unsigned int hostSubnet = ipaddr & m_SubnetMask;
00765                 if (hostSubnet == m_Subnet)
00766                 {
00767                         internal = 1;
00768                 }
00769         }
00770         return internal;
00771 }

00773 
00774 //
00775 // BaseSocketManager::GetHostByName                                     - Chapter 16, page 626
00776 //
00777 unsigned int BaseSocketManager::GetHostByName(std::string hostName)
00778 {
00779         struct hostent *pHostEnt; 
00780     struct sockaddr_in tmpSockAddr; //placeholder for the ip address
00781 
00782     //This will retrieve the ip details and put it into pHostEnt structure
00783         pHostEnt = gethostbyname(hostName.c_str());
00784 
00785     if(pHostEnt == NULL)
00786     {
00787         assert(0 && _T("Error occured"));
00788         return 0;
00789     }
00790 
00791     memcpy(&tmpSockAddr.sin_addr,pHostEnt->h_addr,pHostEnt->h_length);
00792         return ntohl(tmpSockAddr.sin_addr.s_addr);
00793 }
00794 
00795 //
00796 // BaseSocketManager::GetHostByAddr                                     - Chapter 16, page 626
00797 //
00798 const char *BaseSocketManager::GetHostByAddr(unsigned int ip)
00799 {
00800         static char host[32];
00801 
00802         int netip = htonl(ip);
00803         LPHOSTENT lpHostEnt = gethostbyaddr((const char *)&netip, 4, PF_INET);
00804 
00805         if (lpHostEnt)
00806         {
00807                 strcpy(host, lpHostEnt->h_name);
00808                 return host;
00809         }
00810 
00811         return NULL;
00812 }
00813 
00814 //
00815 // BaseSocketManager::PrintError                                        - added post press
00816 //
00817 void BaseSocketManager::PrintError()
00818 {
00819         int realError = WSAGetLastError();
00820         TCHAR *reason;
00821 
00822         switch(realError)
00823         {
00824                 case WSANOTINITIALISED: reason = _T("A successful WSAStartup must occur before using this API."); break;
00825                 case WSAEFAULT: reason = _T("The Windows Sockets implementation was unable to allocated needed resources for its internal operations, or the readfds, writefds, exceptfds, or timeval parameters are not part of the user address space."); break;
00826                 case WSAENETDOWN: reason = _T("The network subsystem has failed."); break;
00827                 case WSAEINVAL: reason = _T("The timeout value is not valid, or all three descriptor parameters were NULL."); break;
00828                 case WSAEINTR: reason = _T("The (blocking) call was canceled via WSACancelBlockingCall."); break;
00829                 case WSAEINPROGRESS: reason = _T("A blocking Windows Sockets 1.1 call is in progress, or the service provider is still processing a callback function."); break;
00830                 case WSAENOTSOCK: reason = _T("One of the descriptor sets contains an entry which is not a socket."); break;
00831                 default: reason = _T("Unknown."); 
00832         }
00833 
00834         TCHAR buffer[256];
00835         _tcssprintf(buffer, _T("SOCKET error: %s\n"), reason);
00836         OutputDebugString(buffer);
00837 }

00840 //
00841 // ClientSocketManager::Connect                                 - Chapter 16, page 627
00842 //
00843 bool ClientSocketManager::Connect()
00844 {
00845         if (!BaseSocketManager::Init())
00846                 return false;
00847 
00848         RemoteEventSocket *pSocket = GCC_NEW RemoteEventSocket;
00849         
00850         if (!pSocket->Connect(GetHostByName(m_HostName), m_Port) )
00851         {
00852                 SAFE_DELETE(pSocket);
00853                 return false;
00854         }
00855         AddSocket(pSocket);
00856         return true;
00857 }

00861 //
00862 // GameServerListenSocket::HandleInput                          - Chapter 16, page 629
00863 //
00864 void GameServerListenSocket::HandleInput() 
00865 {
00866         SOCKET new_sock;
00867         unsigned int theipaddr;
00868 
00869         new_sock = AcceptConnection(&theipaddr);
00870 
00871         int x = 1;
00872         setsockopt(new_sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_DONTLINGER, (char *)&x, sizeof(x));
00873 
00874         if (new_sock != INVALID_SOCKET)
00875         {
00876                 RemoteEventSocket * sock = GCC_NEW RemoteEventSocket(new_sock, theipaddr);
00877                 int sockId = g_pSocketManager->AddSocket(sock);
00878                 safeQueEvent( EventPtr( GCC_NEW Evt_Remote_Client( sockId ) ) );
00879         }
00880  }

00887 
00888 //
00889 // RemoteEventSocket::HandleInput                               - Chapter 16, page 632
00890 //
00891 void RemoteEventSocket::HandleInput()
00892 {
00893         NetSocket::HandleInput();
00894 
00895         // traverse the list of m_InList packets and do something useful with them
00896         while (!m_InList.empty())
00897         {
00898                 shared_ptr<IPacket> packet = *m_InList.begin();
00899                 m_InList.pop_front();
00900                 if (!strcmp(packet->VGetType(), BinaryPacket::g_Type))
00901                 {
00902                         const char *buf = packet->VGetData();
00903                         int size = static_cast<int>(packet->VGetSize());
00904 
00905                         std::istrstream in(buf+sizeof(u_long), (size-sizeof(u_long)));
00906                         
00907                         int type;
00908                         in >> type;
00909                         switch(type)
00910                         {
00911                                 case NetMsg_Event:
00912                                         CreateEvent(in);
00913                                         break;
00914 
00915                                 case NetMsg_PlayerLoginOk:
00916                                 {
00917                                         int vid;
00918                                         in >> vid;
00919                                         g_pApp->m_pGame->SetPlayer(GameView_Human, vid, 0);
00920                                         break;
00921                                 }
00922 
00923 
00924                                 default:
00925                                         assert(0 && _T("Unknown message type."));
00926                         }
00927                 }
00928                 else if (!strcmp(packet->VGetType(), TextPacket::g_Type))
00929                 {
00930                         OutputDebugStringA(packet->VGetData()+sizeof(u_long));
00931                 }
00932         }
00933 }
00934 
00935 
00936 //
00937 // RemoteEventSocket::CreateEvent                               - Chapter 16, page 633
00938 //
00939 void RemoteEventSocket::CreateEvent(std::istrstream &in)
00940 {
00941         char eventType[256];
00942         in >> eventType;
00943         
00944         if (!stricmp(eventType, Evt_New_Game::gkName))
00945         {
00946                 safeQueEvent(EventPtr(GCC_NEW Evt_New_Game(in)));
00947         }
00948         else if (!stricmp(eventType, Evt_Game_State::gkName))
00949         {
00950                 safeQueEvent(EventPtr(GCC_NEW Evt_Game_State(in)));
00951         }
00952         else if (!stricmp(eventType, Evt_New_Actor::gkName))
00953         {
00954                 safeQueEvent(EventPtr(GCC_NEW Evt_New_Actor(in)));
00955         }
00956         else if (!stricmp(eventType, Evt_Move_Actor::gkName))
00957         {
00958                 safeQueEvent(EventPtr(GCC_NEW Evt_Move_Actor(in)));
00959         }
00960         else if (!stricmp(eventType, Evt_Destroy_Actor::gkName))
00961         {
00962                 safeQueEvent(EventPtr(GCC_NEW Evt_Destroy_Actor(in)));
00963         }
00964         else if (!stricmp(eventType, Evt_Fire_Weapon::gkName))
00965         {
00966                 safeQueEvent(EventPtr(GCC_NEW Evt_Fire_Weapon(in)));
00967         }
00968         else if (!stricmp(eventType, Evt_Thrust::gkName))
00969         {
00970                 safeQueEvent(EventPtr(GCC_NEW Evt_Thrust(in)));
00971         }
00972         else if (!stricmp(eventType, Evt_Steer::gkName))
00973         {
00974                 safeQueEvent(EventPtr(GCC_NEW Evt_Steer(in)));
00975         }
00976         else
00977         {
00978                 char debugMessage[256];
00979                 sprintf(debugMessage, "ERROR Unknown event type from remote: %s\n", eventType);
00980                 OutputDebugStringA(debugMessage);
00981         }
00982 }
00983 
00984 
00985 
00986 //
00987 // NetworkEventForwarder::HandleEvent                   - Chapter 16, page 634
00988 //
00989 bool NetworkEventForwarder::HandleEvent( Event const & event )
00990 {
00991         std::ostrstream out;
00992 
00993         out << static_cast<int>(RemoteEventSocket::NetMsg_Event) << " ";
00994         out << event.getType().getStr() << " ";
00995         event.serialize(out);
00996         out << "\r\n";
00997 
00998         shared_ptr<BinaryPacket> eventMsg(GCC_NEW BinaryPacket(out.rdbuf()->str(), out.pcount()));
00999 
01000         g_pSocketManager->Send(m_sockId, eventMsg);
01001         return true;
01002 }

01004 
01005 //
01006 // NetworkGameView::VOnAttach                                   - Chapter 16, page 635
01007 //
01008 void NetworkGameView::VOnAttach(GameViewId viewId, optional<ActorId> aid)
01009 {
01010 
01011         m_ViewId = viewId; 
01012         m_PlayerActorId = aid;
01013 
01014         // this is the first thing that happens when the 
01015         // network view is attached. The view id is sent, 
01016         // which we'll add to the binary events that get sent.
01017 
01018         std::ostrstream out;
01019 
01020         out << static_cast<int>(RemoteEventSocket::NetMsg_PlayerLoginOk) << " ";
01021         out << viewId << " ";
01022         out << "\r\n";
01023 
01024         shared_ptr<BinaryPacket> gvidMsg(GCC_NEW BinaryPacket(out.rdbuf()->str(), out.pcount()));
01025         g_pSocketManager->Send(m_SockId, gvidMsg);
01026 }
